comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:7.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0
Build ID: 20110922153450

Steps to reproduce:

I'm managing a large domain controlled network used by students (also). The goal is to specify somehow that when you use FF for the first time the newly created profile to be located on a network drive (e.g. z:\mozilla\firefox) and not in the default %APPDATA%\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\ place.




Actual results:

With the FF 3.x series the solution applied was to put a modified profiles.ini file in the c:\Default User\Application Data\Mozilla\Firefox directory. In that profiles.ini the Path variable has the value Z:\mozilla\firefox. As a result any newly created profile place was in the directory mentioned by PATH.

After installing the FF new series (6.x, 7.0) the abovementioned behaviour stopped working. So, at this moment I don't know how to tell FF to create all new profiles elsewhere than the default place.



Expected results:

Is there any possibility to restore the old behaviour ?
